text: Cloudy golden with a tiny white head. Fruity and flowery notes. malt, fruit, flowers and bitterness. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet finish.

Draught at Mikkeller/To Øl week, Ölrepubliken. 
Quick rating.
Golden, slightly hazy, off-white head.
Fruity and hoppy with citrus dominating, but I thought under that it was a bit watery. Medium bitter. Medium bodied with a dry finish.

On tap. Pours an almost clear deep golden with a white head. Intense hop aroma - bordering astringent. Medium body, lightly caramellish yet surprisingly dry with a very intense hopping. Again an almost astringent bitterness. 281012

Aroma: Smelling of tropical fruits, mango, pine and grape-fruit.Appearance: A clear light amber colored beer. An off-white head with some lacing and good curtains.Taste: Tasting of brown bread, toffee, tropical marmalade and grape-fruit peel.Palate: Medium low carbonation, a soft and oily texture. A medium body with a somewhat dry finish.Overall: A nice very hop dominated lager. Almost too much.Note: On-tap. Reviewed 2012-11-01.

Draught at Ölrepubliken on October 29, 2012During the tap take over from Mikkeller and To Øl.Hazy deep golden color, dense off-white head. Bitter, grapefruit, hoppy, some chili, dry taste. Medium mouthfeel, high bitterness. Lingering dry grapefruit tasting bitterness. Hoppy, grapefruit scent.Rather unbalanced, hop focused, lacks malt body.

Draught at På Besök.
A dry hoppy brew, some grape seeds. Pilsner carachter body but the hop domination makes it mainly APA like.

26-OCT-2012, draught @Mikkeller. 
Golden lasting almost white head. 
Citric with fruity hoppy stuff. But also a saison-like yeasty (or hoppy?) spicyness. Very fresh. Medium carbonation and body. Finish is bitter. Fine pils.

Times are bad at Mikkeller Bar. Were all out of Vesterbro Pils, the tumbleweeds are a-blowing, oh what a pilsner-desert! But behold!, here comes Amnecia. With an aroma bursting with Nelson and Amarillo on top of a crisp crusty malt note - the mouths are drooling again. The pints are a-flowin with Amnecia. All kinds of citrus fruit notes make the taste - orange, tangerine, lime zest, pineapple. Its like the hops almost add a tartness, because this beer is so citrusy. Im afraid that the almighty Colossus of Vesterbro Pils now has a worthy opponent. Tore and Tobias are gonna invade Mikkeller Bar, and take over the empire. Bartenders be summoned, grab yer sword and defend! Were not going down without a fight!

Tap at Mikkeller. Slightly unclear amber with a small off white head, Crisp fresh citrus, peach, mango, tea, light toast. Dry, fruity bitter mouthfeel. Simple but nice. To øl have a way with lagers, as alwats crisp, hoppy and clean.

Draught at På Besök, MalmöHazy golden color; creamy head. Nice fruity hops aroma, pungent. Good toffee flavor, with light residual sweetness; the hop is strong, a bit fruity, but mainly resiny. Long final. It has a bit of dirty, earthy character, typical in modern American pale ales.Good and refreshing.

Draught at På Besök, Malmö.  Hazy golden/amber, small head. Rich mango/lychee/black currant aroma. Mid sweet with medium body and clean mouthfeel. Fruity with a whiff of syrup before black currant hops blows all that away. Mid bitter finish.
Draught on På Besök. An APA inspired wellhopped lager. Fruithy, malty with a dry bitter finish. Nice hop-profile. A really good lager.
Draught at På Besøg. Clear amber/golden - white head. Nice fresh hoppy. Nice fruity. Citrus. Orange. Crispy. Light toasted. Nice bitterness. Super high freshness. Thanks for this lovely beer....

Draft @ På Besök, Malmö. Pours a pale amber color with a longlasting white head. Has a fruity peachy hoppy fresh aroma. Fruity malty hoppy peachy flavor with some bitterness. Has a fruity malty peachy hoppy bitter finish.
Draft. An amber beer wiyh a beige head. The aroma has notes of malt and straw. The flavor iis sweet with notes of malt and caramel, leading ti a bitter finish.

Draught at På Besök.
Clear orange coloured with a small off-white head.
Fruity aroma of grass, hops and pine needles with notes of citrus peel.
Fruity flavour of hops, grapefruits and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

From tap at På Besøk. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, crisp citrusy and peachy. Bitter and dry. Nice and easy. Smooth fruity and crisp hoppy into the finish. Great session beer.
